SENT.plain: In two patients fatal veno-occlusive disease of the liver developed after bone marrow transplantation for underlying malignancies
Both had received significant pretransplant chemotherapy, including cystosine arabinoside, and total body irradiation
The diagnosis of veno-occlusive disease should be considered in patients in whom hepatomegaly, ascites and deteriorating liver function tests develop after they have received cancer chemotherapy
